title: Bug 49890 - Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
description: Server's CPU reaches and remains at 100% until server restart when using NioEndpoint.java with a simple web application on the Linux platform. This issue has been observed across multiple Java versions (1.6.007, 1.6.018, 1.6.021). It appears to be a duplicate of Bug 46373, which was addressed by the Jetty team (http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel). Additional logging has been added to NioEndpoint.java for investigation.
OB: Server's CPU usage consistently hits 100% and remains at that level indefinitely until the server is restarted.
EB: To replicate the JVM bug, perform multiple requests to the web application (e.g., press F5 in the browser and hold the button).
SR:
1. Run the web application using NioEndpoint.java on a Linux platform.
2. Perform multiple requests to the application by pressing F5 in the browser and keeping the button pressed.
3. Observe the server's CPU usage reaching and staying at 100% until the server is restarted.
